Subject: Re: [cantera] size attribute of species

Hi Paul,

It seems like you should be able to dictate the size of your surface
species in the reaction equation.  Wouldn't the reaction equation

" ads + 2 S => ads(S) "

give Cantera all the info it needs in terms of the 'size' attribute
(where 'ads' is the unbound species, 'S' an empty surface site, and
ads(S) the bound species)?

Your definition for the species 'ads(S)' would have to include all
the atoms in 'S' (times two), but unless there's something I'm not
thinking of, I think this would have the same effect as declaring
'size = 2.'

Hope this helps,
Steven



--- peyelvington <pyelvington@...> wrote:

> Dear Dave and Group,
> 
> I'm trying to use the "size" attribute of a species to specify the
> number of sites that a surface-bound species occupies (n_k in eqn.
> 3.4
> of the "Defining Phases and Intefaces"). I get an error from
> ct2ctml
> when I try to include this keyword. The ct2ctml.log file reads...
> 
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   ...
>   File "./Si3N4.cti", line 73, in ?
>     note = "J 3/67"
> TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'size'
> 
> This species is declared like this in my cti file...
> 
> species(name = "SIF3NH2(S)",
>     atoms = " N:1  H:2  Si:1  F:3 ",
>     size = 2,
>     thermo = (
>        NASA( [  300.00,  1000.00], [ 8.419753800E-001, 
> 8.371041600E-003, 
>               -1.307703000E-005,  9.759360300E-009,
> -2.727938000E-012,
>               -5.248628800E+002, -4.527267800E+000] ),
>        NASA( [ 1000.00,  1685.00], [ 2.475398900E+000, 
> 8.811218700E-004, 
>               -2.093948100E-007,  4.275718700E-012, 
> 1.600656400E-014,
>               -8.125562000E+002, -1.218874700E+001] )
>              ),
>     note = "J 3/67"
>        )
> 
> Any ideas on where I might be going wrong? Thanks very much.
> 
> Best,
> 
> Paul
>
